JUDGES: Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Nebojša Vučinić;Nicolas Bratza;Päivi Hirvelä
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in LOC .

CARDINAL . The applicant and his brother , PERSON , leased a substantial area of farming land . After the applicant had been hospitalised , he asked his brother to gather the crops . The applicant submits that his brother sold the crops and the agricultural machines which they co - owned and took all the profits .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought a claim against his brother in ORG , seeking MONEY ( ORG ) in compensation . He also sought an exemption from court fees ( ORG MONEY ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG exempted the applicant from court fees . On DATE it granted legal aid to the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant modified his claim by joining his brother 's wife as a defendant . He also requested the court to issue an interim order to secure his claims by way of , inter alia , registering a charge over the defendants ' property and attaching their bank accounts . On DATE the applicant submitted some additional information requested by the court in relation to his request for an interim measure . On DATE ORG granted the interim order in part .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant increased his claim to PLN CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG revoked the applicant 's exemption from court fees and the decision to grant him legal aid . ORG considered that the information in the file indicated that the applicant was not an indigent person unable to pay court fees and other costs related to the litigation . It noted that the applicant owned QUANTITY houses and that in DATE he had had MONEY deposited in the bank . Thus , ORG found that the applicant had not submitted accurate information about his financial status . Consequently , it imposed a fine on the applicant in the amount of ORG CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against that decision . He contested the court 's findings . The applicant submitted that a charge had been registered over his property in PERSON , while the other property , located in LOC , was a small house where he lived with his extended family . He further stated that all his savings had been invested in the farming of the leased land and that he had been deprived of any profits by his brother . He further submitted that his only income was a modest invalidity benefit .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal . It relied on the fact that the applicant had failed to disclose all the relevant information about his financial status in his original application for an exemption from court fees .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant to pay ORG MONEY in court fees . On DATE the applicant applied for leave to pay the relevant fees in instalments . He claimed that he had been receiving invalidity benefit and could not pay the amount in question all at once . He also submitted that he could not take up any offers of work because of his poor health .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted the applicant leave to pay the court fees in CARDINAL DATE instalments . Until DATE the applicant paid CARDINAL instalments .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant increased his claim to ORG CARDINAL , following the submission of a number of documents by the defendant which indicated the amount of profit made from the jointly leased land .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant to pay ORG CARDINAL in court fees for the modification of his claim .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the court to exempt him from those court fees and to cancel the CARDINAL remaining DATE instalments he was supposed to pay . The applicant submitted that his only income was an invalidity benefit in the DATE amount of ORG MONEY and that he was unfit for work . He stated that he had been hospitalised from DATE until DATE and that he had subsequently broken his spine and had again been hospitalised . He further submitted that he had transferred his property in LOC by way of a donation to his children . The other property , located in LOC , was a wooden house in need of renovation and lacking basic amenities . The applicant also supported CARDINAL of his children DATE . His wife worked at a school and her DATE salary was ORG . He did not have any savings and owned a fouryear - old NORP car .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused the applicant 's request for exemption from the court fees . It held , referring to the case - law of ORG from DATE and DATE , that the donation of the applicant 's property to his children should be treated as a fraudulent disposal of the property with a view to fulfilling the eligibility requirements for exemption from court fees . Additionally , ORG considered that the applicant had adult children who had an obligation to support him financially if necessary . That obligation extended , in the court 's view , to helping the applicant in funding the court proceedings .

CARDINAL . Furthermore , ORG considered that the applicant could have sold some of his property or mortgaged it . That way , in the court 's view , the applicant would have been able to secure sufficient means for funding the litigation . ORG underlined that the applicant 's case was not one in which it had been necessary to file a claim immediately . The court observed that a party intending to institute court proceedings had to take into account the costs involved and secure them in advance from the income received over a longer period of time . Only in exceptional cases , when the immediate institution of proceedings was necessary ( on account of the limitation of actions ) , could a party rely exclusively on his or her current income .

CARDINAL . ORG considered that the applicant , when increasing his claim to ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL , had to take into account the obligation to pay the relevant fees , even more so given that it had not been necessary to modify his claim at that particular time .

CARDINAL . The applicant appealed against ORG decision . He submitted that he had not disposed of any of his property in order to obtain an exemption from court fees since he still owned the property in PERSON . However , that latter property did not generate any profit . The applicant disagreed with ORG regarding the motives behind his donation . He stated that he had simply wanted to provide for his children 's future . The applicant emphasised that he had no possibility of securing the required amount of court fees and that the impugned decision had been based on speculation about his financial status . Replying to ORG argument about the possibility of securing the necessary funds over a period of time , the applicant submitted that given his current level of income and his incapacity for work , he would never be able to secure the necessary funds .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of ORG . It further concurred with ORG finding that disposing of the applicant 's property in LOC by way of donation could not justify another exemption from court fees .
CARDINAL . It appears that on a later unknown date the applicant paid the remaining CARDINAL instalments and the court proceeded with the examination of the merits of the case .
CARDINAL . Following a request of DATE , ORG exempted the defendants S.K and PERSON from the court fees at a session held in camera on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant once again increased his claim to ORG MONEY ( instead of the initial ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) . The court fee was set at ORG CARDINAL and the applicant asked for an exemption . The request was dismissed by ORG on DATE . The court held that while it was true that the applicant and his wife supported themselves from small invalidity pensions , the applicant owned a house in LOC . The court stressed that since the applicant had donated his property to his children , they should have helped him with the court fees . Lastly , the court held that the applicant did not justify the increased claim by any new facts or evidence but merely asked for a higher sum . On CARDINAL DATE ORG upheld this decision repeating the same reasons .

CARDINAL . At a hearing held on DATE the applicant again decided to modify his claim and increased it , this time to ORG MONEY ( instead of the ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) . On DATE ORG dismissed his request to exempt him from court fees . The court referred to the reasons previously given .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment and dismissed the applicant 's claim . The judgment became final on DATE .
